intro: Sinocarum dolichopodum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed sinocarum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
